newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Polartechnics to announce U.S. alliance.
newsitem.headline: Polartechnics to announce U.S. alliance.

text.p: Medical instrument designer and manufacturer Polartechnics Ltd said on Tuesday it would announce details of a strategic agreement with a major U.S.-based multinational company soon.
"It will be within the next day or so. It's really a question of when their (the U.S. company's) PR people are ready," managing director Victor Skladnev told Reuters.
Asked if a deal had been signed, Skladnev said: "I wouldn't make an announcement like this unless I was reasonably sure. It would be devastating for the share price."
Trading in Polartechnics was halted on Monday at the company's request pending an announcement.
The stock rose 12 cents to A$2.48 on Friday.
Polartechnics in November told shareholders it was negotiating with three U.S. companies on an alliance.

"The company has decided to seek a strategic alliance with a major company for marketing and distribution of the Polarprobe in North and South America, and possibly elsewhere," chairman Tony Grey told shareholders at the annual general meeting.
Polarprobe is a cancer detection device.
